author: Anonymous Scale
title: What is a template tag?
question:
In problem 6, we are given a template tag. I don't understand what that is. 
I was also wondering what the purpose of
(@htdf taller-image)
is. I don't really get how it works, and when I was trying to run the code in Dr Racket, I got errors over it.
student_answer:
It’s mostly to let DrRacket know what type of design recipe you’re writing.
The @htdf section tells DrRacket that you’re writing a how to design functions design recipe. (there are other design recipes that will use different @s later on.) The function name right after tells DrRacket that the design recipe is for the function with that name.
You might be getting errors over it if the second part isn’t exactly the name of your function.
You are guaranteed to get an error if you don't define taller-image somewhere else in the code.
